Line 77: Line 77:      
There is an oppositional element in Christian thought between [[secular]] wisdom and Godly wisdom. The [[apostle Paul]] states that worldly wisdom thinks the claims of [[Christ]] to be foolishness. However, to those who are "on the path to salvation" Christ represents the wisdom of God. ({{bibleref|1Corinthians|1:17–31}}) Also, Wisdom is one of the [[seven gifts of the Holy Spirit]] according to Anglican, Catholic, and Lutheran belief. {{bibleref|1Corinthians|12:8–10}} gives an alternate list of nine virtues, among which wisdom is one.
 
There is an oppositional element in Christian thought between [[secular]] wisdom and Godly wisdom. The [[apostle Paul]] states that worldly wisdom thinks the claims of [[Christ]] to be foolishness. However, to those who are "on the path to salvation" Christ represents the wisdom of God. ({{bibleref|1Corinthians|1:17–31}}) Also, Wisdom is one of the [[seven gifts of the Holy Spirit]] according to Anglican, Catholic, and Lutheran belief. {{bibleref|1Corinthians|12:8–10}} gives an alternate list of nine virtues, among which wisdom is one.
  +
Revelation 13:18 talks about wisdom. I say it is the periodic table of the elements. Those were some smart guys that invented that thing. That means I'm the beast.
